result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard B Isaac was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $10.00 per month commencing 06/01/2016 and each month thereafter until paid in full.  Defendant may also perform Community Service at the rate of $10.00/hour in lieu of payment of fine. May complete at group home he resides in.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard B Isaac

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Richard B Isaac in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for review of competency.  Attorney Kershek states he does not contest doctor's findings, finding Defendant competent to proceed.  Court finds Defendant competent to proceed based on doctor's findings and stipulation of the parties.  Court passes case so Attorney Kershek can go through plea form with Defendant.  Case is re-called at 11:40 a.m.  Defendant enters a no contest alford plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Kershek makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  FINE: $50.00 - all costs and surcharges are WAIVED - (to be paid at $10.00 per month, commencing 6/1/16 or Defendant may perform community service in lieu of payments at rate of $10.00 per hour and may be performed at group home Defendant resides at.)

** Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**
Filed by Dr. Luzi.

Defendant Richard B Isaac in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek requests a competency evaluation under Sec. 971.14.  Court orders competency evaluation upon Attorney Kershek's request.  Court sets review hearing.    Bail remains as fixed.  Review hearing scheduled for May 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.
